instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message:
Right guys, time to fix my personal laptop. something i have not really looked at in depth yet. 

Before someone says 'keyboard power button' Its not. It also runs of battery just fine.
Does an SMC reset, but if i turn it of its dead again till i plug it into a charger. Something around the SMC not right maybe?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message: Does the power button work to turn it off, but not work to turn it on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message: Is the battery recognized in OSX, proper cycles, Mah, etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message: Ooooh, im surprised i havent noticed that before, as soon as i hit the power button the thing SMC resets, That'll be what im looking for!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> and associated components replaced due to damage there prior. 

<CHIP>U5750</CHIP> replaced, no change in symtoms, ill look at it in the future, bet its something iffy to do with the SMC i fitted to this board long ago (or maybe the KBC).

Tested the keyboard with another board and it doesn't have the same symptoms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> ? And you didn't answer my question about the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 13491"]Voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> ? And you didn't answer my question about the battery.[/QUOTE]

3.4V 
i will get the battery information in just a moment however im not sure that would cause an SMC reset, i believe it still SMC resets like this when the battery is unplugged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but only when charger is connected.
threads.message: So as soon as you hit the power button the light turns green? Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> goes low if you hit the power button.
